body_html:
Very disappointed with your answer. This issue has been reported for months but no one indeed to investigate why.
From my deep investigation and understanding, I feel that is absolutely a bug in your Demo.
The Op ResizeBilinear in Tensorflow is squeeze the image and what you have done in Android Demo is not. Why there is no problem in your demo? You capture images with size is nearly a square, which the width and height are close to each other. So that the two algorithm will not affect the result much.
But, in my test, I use images with rectangle size, which width is much large than the height. So these two different algorithm of resizing image will bring 10% inaccuracy in the result.

body:
Very disappointed with your answer. This issue has been reported for months but no one indeed to investigate why. 
From my deep investigation and understanding, I feel that is absolutely a bug in your Demo.
The Op ResizeBilinear in Tensorflow is squeeze the image and what you have done in Android Demo is not. Why there is no problem in your demo? You capture images with size is nearly a square, which the width and height are close to each other. So that the two algorithm will not affect the result much.
But, in my test, I use images with rectangle size, which width is much large than the height. So these two different algorithm of resizing image will bring 10% inaccuracy in the result.
